question: Does short-term chenodeoxycholic acid (CDCA) treatment increase whole-body energy expenditure in healthy adults? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Whole-body energy expenditure was also increased upon CDCA treatment.
content.source_2: In a cohort of 12 healthy women administered chenodeoxycholic acid for two consecutive days, BAT activity increased, yet ventilated-hood indirect calorimetry showed no elevation in whole-body energy expenditure.
content.source_3: In murine brown adipose tissue, stimulating TGR5 with bile acids failed to upregulate D2 and did not augment oxygen consumption or energy expenditure.
